newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Santos union to propose ending strike at meeting.
newsitem.headline: Santos union to propose ending strike at meeting.

text.p: Leaders of the Administrative Portworkers' Union at Santos will propose suspending a strike and returning to work on Thursday morning at an assembly to be held later on Wednesday, a senior union official said.
Earlier, a judge at the Sao Paulo Labor Tribunal asked that despite strong disagreements between the workers and the port authority CODESP, the unions suspend their strike immediately.
"I think the assembly will respect the labor tribunal's proposal," said Jurandir Franca da Hora.
Asked if he would suggest the union vote in favor of going back to work, he replied, "Absolutely."
The union has called an assembly for 2000 local/2300 GMT. If they did agree to the proposal, workers would resume normal shifts as of 0700 local/1000 GMT Thursday, da Hora said.
The workers have been on strike since Tuesday over CODESP's failure to consult unions about a switch to 24-hour operations at the port.
